@lguohan  Can you please review and merge?
has this been verify on 201911 ?
@abdosi  I verified the reboot and soft-reboot script on top of 20191130.78.
@renukamanavalan please elaborate how your tested this change?

Manually copied the disk_check.py onto device running 201811 at /usr/local/bin/.
Updated /etc/monit/conf.d/sonic-host as in PR 8951 (buildimage)
Restarted monit service
Ensured the switch has TACACS confgured 
Make disk read-only
After a pause, tested to login using a remote user credentials of a user who has not logged in before into this device.
In other words, ensure that this created entry in /etc/passwd & created home dir for this user
It worked as expected
Did a device reboot
Confirmed that there is no trace of that user in device (as the updates were done on tmpfs)
AFAIK, Loopback interface is always admin up. What is the use-case here? Also can you check where all this function is being called and ensure those commands can work for Loopback as well?

> AFAIK, Loopback interface is always admin up. What is the use-case here? Also can you check where all this function is being called and ensure those commands can work for Loopback as well?

In sonic-mgmt testbed with SONiC neighbor devices, the testbed will try to startup all interfaces no matter Loopback interface or not. The behavior to startup or shutdown a loopback interface is acceptable to EOS (Arista Switch VM OS). So, I guess SONiC should also accept this behavior.
Add unitest

* 4 for Wrong number of arguments in a call
* 1 for First parameter of a method is not named 'self'

> Can the neighbor_advertiser be skipped while invoking warmboot instead of modifying the script?

Reason I am doing it inside the script is because the setup for warmboot and finalizer are two seperate files and I think it is easier to  have this inside the script which is called by both cases instead of spread out to multiple files.

> > Can the neighbor_advertiser be skipped while invoking warmboot instead of modifying the script?
> 
> Reason I am doing it inside the script is because the setup for warmboot and finalizer are two seperate files and I think it is easier to have this inside the script which is called by both cases instead of spread out to multiple files.

If you fix this in setup for warmboot, isn't finalizer a no-op? As in, even if it try to remove the entries in finalizer, it will not trigger anything since its non-existent, right?

> > > Can the neighbor_advertiser be skipped while invoking warmboot instead of modifying the script?
> > 
> > 
> > Reason I am doing it inside the script is because the setup for warmboot and finalizer are two seperate files and I think it is easier to have this inside the script which is called by both cases instead of spread out to multiple files.
> 
> If you fix this in setup for warmboot, isn't finalizer a no-op? As in, even if it try to remove the entries in finalizer, it will not trigger anything since its non-existent, right?

Interesting idea.  Let me give it a try just on the setup for warmboot to see if that works.  If so, I will create a new PULL request.
Thanks!

@prsunny I have modified the code per your comment.  Please help review the new changes.
Thanks!
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

The failures seem to be coming due to a sonic-swss dvs switch creation error.
Yesterday this was supposedly fixed on sonic-swss - https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1949

Buildimage update is in progress - https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/8915

I suggest to retry after buildimage PR is merged.

> The failures seem to be coming due to a sonic-swss dvs switch creation error. Yesterday this was supposedly fixed on sonic-swss - [Azure/sonic-swss#1949](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1949)

Will wait for that swss PR pulled into sonic-buildimage before attempting restart azp run.

@vivekreddynv it would be great if you could test your change with https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/tree/master/tests/show_techsupport.

> Please take #1844, #1846 as example, fixing the code before check in. Make sure your code passes sonic-mgmt show_techsupport tests.

Hi @yxieca, 

Thanks for pointing out these false positive cases. 

Changes, for this PR were merged in master and 202012. pending in 202106.
The fix1 you've raised, is in master and 202012, pending in 202106. 
The fix2 is pending in all 3. 

I would suggest, merging this PR in 202106, followed by fix1 and fix2. 

I will see what other sections of the code has the false positives issue and will verify the fixes by running the techsupport test. Will raise separate PR's after this?

What do you think?

@vivekredynv, what I noticed from making change for 202012 branch is that that branch is different from master branch, therefore more changes are needed. If you could make these  changes and making sure they are complete, that would be better than missing a few and having to come back change again.

Okay, it seems https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/1846 can't be cleanly cherry-picked to 202012. I'll manually port #1846 (any other fixes required) for 202012. 

But both the #1844 & #1846 can be cleanly cherry-picked for **202106**. Thus i would suggest to merge this PR,  followed by 1844 & 1846. That'll put master & 202106 in a consistent state. 

And if i have to make any changes to these two branches, it'll be easy to cherry-pick to both of them
@vivekreddynv is it ok to take it to 202106 or something else is missing?

> Please don't merge until ready to cherry-pick #1844 right after merging this PR.

@vivekreddynv I see the above comment from Ying, is this PR ready to be merged ?
@yxieca could you please help to review or suggest assignee?

Please give more explanation on the question "What I did". This PR actually changes behavior.
